messages.content: happy birthday from the future!
Happy New Year to you!
happy new year kat!
Oh my gosh - they are gorgeous! ð¥°
Definitely!
will reply "properly" later but just wanted to say that it's SO nice to catch up after all these years, eh?

Oh that is such a crazy story! So he is very much a BC person from all the years of being there. It's home, in many ways. But so good that he gets to be with you all in Japan for an extended stay. My mom and aunt spent quite a lot of time at our home when our kids were younger as Al would be off traveling the world and I would be on my own juggling work and the kids. So they each babied the kids in so many ways. We sent Pablo off to college knowing that he was very capable academically, socially, and in his sports, but could he really do a load of laundry or prepare anything other than breakfast for himself?? We quickly learned that he could not ;-) So there were texts and calls to get guidance that he was too embarrassed to ask his peers for. Now that he is in a house with a group of guys, he has figured out that they are all very accomplished (changing their own oil, assembling IKEA furniture, cooking up a storm). So he is learning from them. It has been really positive. he arrives tomorrow and I am hoping he can help his sister prepare for finals as it is a literal crap show around here ;-) Al and I were up late trying to help her to organize study notes and submit past due assignments. We are too old for this bullshit ;-) But we also want her to get into a college (any college!) and get out of our house :-)

It's quite fascinating to see how my mother's perspective has changed over the years. She would let me take a 30-minute bus ride on my own when in grade 3, but would freak at her grandchildren doing the same thing when they're years and years older. And she does not like being reminded of such things!
He'll be back in Japan this weekend for almost a month â¦ he'll get to see his mom in Kyoto, and me here in Tokyo.
He went back only once since school started in September, which makes me happy.  It was for his birthday.

Anyway, at age 20, he is getting some life skills as a result of living on his own.  It's not really that far from the Sunshine Coast, but, with the ferry, it feels a bit further away than it really is.
I was in Japan the whole time â¦ great dad, eh?!?

So, Riku spent the last four years of school in BC. First of those was living with Susan in Victoria. Next three, with my folks in Gibsons. My mom treated him like the god he isn't, pampered and babied him. Nice for him but not so great for his future.

I have found it easy to coordinate logistics of having a college kid just a few hours away at Cal Poly but how are you managing between BC and Japan?? I can imagine there are no quick visits home for celebrations and gatherings. It is quite the journey! But I am guessing this has helped to foster more independence? Overall a good thing?
but i think iâm the #1 in her life, which is quite nice â¤ï¸
mirei has become more of a spitfire the last few years â¦ not the biggest fan ð¥´
i can also relate. iâm not worried about mine in terms of survival and (relative) happiness, but iâm worried about both re: reaching/approaching their potential.

Oh my gosh - I can relate! Bianca struggles to focus with her assignments (off the charts ADHD) but is creative, funny, bright, perceptive. She will attend a state college rather than a UC and will need to be flexible on where she goes as she doesn't have top grades. Her criteria for choosing colleges is amusing as being a "top party school" is on the list :-) She is our free spirit for sure. Pablo is the total opposite - laser focused, patient, diligent. Has always been so dedicated to his studies and his sports. But they have each been this way from birth and I realize our influence is limited ;-) Al and I support and encourage them but mostly step aside as they have such strong ideas. (Bianca is so headstrong, if we took away her phone I honestly think she would pack her bags and leave town). She has been a spitfire from the beginning. I think she needs a warning label for her poor future husband ;-)
Oh, Tajh's eldest son just started engineering at UBC (a school Riku tried to get into, but â¦). From my short visit with him, that guy, and his partner, are doing a kick-ass job parenting.
Susan's daughter is at UBC. She and Riku are good buddies (they've known each other since they were zero!).
I'm being a bit hardcore with her (e.g. she's had zero access to her phone for several weeks now), but she's still talking to me ð.

! Riku is doing a year one restart, and handling it better this time around. Mirei is a smart cookie but is struggling with confidence and actually getting her assignments done. Luckily, she has some good friends and classmates here, and I am still optimistic. She will either go to school in Canada or the US, still TBD.

Oh my gosh! You have had so many adventures! I feel very boring in comparison ;-) Still the same husband and even the same house!! Our kids are living parallel lives, though! Our son is at Cal Poly while our daughter is in her 11th grade here in Half Moon Bay. We thought it was adventurous that she  is considering colleges out of state. Meanwhile, your daughter may want to leave the country all together! Do you think she might want to join her brother in BC? Then you would really be empty nesters!!
son is at SFU â¦ daughter, grade 11 here in tokyo (international school)
â minako
susan approves! we went to a show together in SF in june
now in tokyo with wife #3 (third time lucky? ð)
moved to kyoto with wife #2 in â09
tokyo!
That is crazy! Wait so where are you living these days? All is good here but a little overwhelming at times! Hubby travels a ton so it is the single mom lifestyle ð
i asked him where he was living and he said âa little BC town called roberts creekâ â¦ we were living five minutes away from each other ð
we had dinner with tajh in june before leaving canada (we were there for nine months) â¦ heâs the same old tajh, good to see him
things are good â¦ and things look good with you guys, eh?
no, i asked you first ð
Long time no see! How are you doing?
hey! howâs life?
